channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2025010445
item.description:
Report X-2025010445

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA leaking. Further inspection reveals that the seal deteriorated causing it to peal and leak. This package is also undeclared as there were no limited quantity markings or hazmat markings, despite the SDS declaring it as a regulated substance, there were also 20 packages with the same type of packaging and product that had the limited quantity diamonds.

item.title: Report X-2025010444
item.description:
Report X-2025010444

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package as brought to QA's attention in Unload. Upon inspection It was found that this package was an undeclared Limited quantity as there was a total of 32 packages of the same product and packaging on the shipment. Most of the other packages of the same packaging and product had limited quantity markings on the package.

item.title: Report X-2025010460
item.description:
Report X-2025010460

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-04
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES,GOGGLES,BOOTS,APRON,SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.ALL TUBS/PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report E-2025010051
item.description:
Report E-2025010051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: FIFE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:40 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UTA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 3 gallons of Klean Strip Acetone (hazardous - UN1090) was released on the trailer; and 9 cans of Fuel -Denatured Alcohol (hazardous - UN1987) was refused by the Consignee. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 4 damaged cans of UN1090 - Acetone will be placed into a 20-gallon metal drum, while the 9 cans of UN1987 - Denatured Alcohol will be placed into a 35-gallon metal drum, and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry.
